parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.58

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Returns all named layers used by [[cutRsc]], [[cutText]], [[cutObj]] or [[cutFadeOut]].
The layer normally would be added on the first use of any of the aforementioned commands, however if a layer needs to be reserved it could be done like so: <br><template><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>_layerNum <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> "TAG_myLayerName" [[cutFadeOut]] 0;</value></part></template>.

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> '''allCutLayers'''

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Array]] - Array of [[Strings]]: The index of the layer name in the array corresponds to the layer number the cut effect will be displayed on. If no layers were defined, the return is <template><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[""]</value></part></template>, because 0 layer is reserved for usage in cut commands without layer param or when name of the layer given is empty <template><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>""</value></part></template>.
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _allLayers = [[allCutLayers]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[cutRsc]] [[cutText]] [[cutObj]] [[cutFadeOut]] [[allActiveTitleEffects]]
</value></part></template></root>
